Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup; slightly outturned rim with offsets in and out; wholly glazed, the exterior fired brownish red in parts.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis) (Site 63 (Hogarth) [see Hogarth, Lorimer and Edgar 1905, 115])
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hogarth, Lorimer and Edgar, p. 117: "The order of the words strongly favours the restoration of the name as Artemis". However, the personal name Artemidoros cannot be discounted, and the word before the name does not appear to be anetheken, but perhaps a name ending in omega nu.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 707, no. 651, pl. 25.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1658)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
